The set difference of $A$ and $B$ written as $A\setminus B$ is defined as
\[
	\left\{ x : x \in A \text{ and } x \not\in B \right\}
\]

== Important Properties ==

* When $A \subseteq B$ then $\left| B\setminus A \right|= \left| B \right| - \left| A \right|$
** This is because you can write $B = B\setminus  A \cup A$, and $B \setminus A, A $ are disjoint therefore $\left| B \right|= \left| B \setminus A \right| + \left| A \right| $  so we have that $\left| B\setminus A \right| = \left| B \right| - \left| A \right|$
